intro: Mahonia chochoco, commonly known as the Chocó mahonia, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the tropical rainforests of western Colombia. It is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers in the spring, which are followed by blue-black berries. Mahonia chochoco thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
